website_summaries.verdict: With improvements to its output speed, the Brother HL-2270DW improves on its legacy model and provides small businesses an efficient output device for high-volume black-and-white prints.
pros: The Brother HL-2270DW lives up to Brother's reputation for reliable, easy-to-use, wireless monochrome laser printers
cons: The printer struggles to provide visually acceptable graphic documents

customer_reviews.title: Very handy to have when they've closed so many businesses.
customer_reviews.text: It works very well and has been a life-saver for me and my family. The library is closed so we don't have access to cheap copies of needed documents. The other places overcharge or are inconvenient due to circumstances. I'm glad I have this printer at this time in this world situation. My family and I are able to easily take care of our business without having to go anywhere. I guess I should be more clear, it does not have a scan on it, but there are plenty of ways around that simply by taking a picture of a document, using a pdf online or offline or a document in your email.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Broke down way too soon
customer_reviews.text: The roller assembly failed way sooner than it should have. The printer stopped taking up paper from the paper tray. The only way to print now is manual feed. I bought a roller assembly but Brother would not give me directions for how to install it (directions for this particular printer cannot be found on the web, either) and told me to take it to one of their service centers. It's out of warranty so a repair would likely cause more than just buying a new printer. I'm very disappointed in Brother. I thought they made higher quality products that would last longer.
customer_reviews.author: jbld

customer_reviews.title: Paper path problems
customer_reviews.text: I had this printer for over 4 years and and happy with the print quality. The paper path however is sub standard. When I use the manual feed I find it next to impossible to send the paper thru straight. When I print envelopes, same problem getting the envelope square with the printer and if you open the back door so the envelope doesn't get wrinkled the envelope comes out the back and dumps on the table or floor. When printing on legal size paper the regular path has a hard time not pushing the already printed pages onto the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Wyoming Lily

customer_reviews.title: Great printer performance
customer_reviews.text: I've bought two of these printers. I bought the first one for my non-technical brother because he was having so much trouble with his inkjet printer fouling up from lack of use. Dang, it installed easily and worked so quickly that I bought one myself. I don't have a color printer and don't really have a need for one - I also had had trouble with the ink cartridges clogging or whatever. Just too much maintenance and expense. This thing works flawlessly and quickly. I love the duplex feature for long forms like tax returns. I obviously purchased another so you can anticipate my vote!
customer_reviews.author: Desert Dweller

customer_reviews.title: Great printer!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for 5 years and it continues to serve my needs. There’s a guy who left a review about it going offline (then he smashed the thing into a thousand pieces)—I’ve had that same issue and it is extremely frustrating, especially because who keeps track of the effing cable?! That said, it’s still my favorite printer. Recently, because I’m an awful person, my cat has started using the printer as her litter box. I desperately needed to print some checks so I thought I’d try it. Guess what. IT STILL WORKS. Also, the cat has continued to use it as a litter box. And the printer has continued to work. It’s bizarre. All of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a few years
customer_reviews.text: I guess all printers are just disposable junk nowadays. I bought two of these, both worthless junk now. There is a fragile white plastic clip that is impossible to reach once it become dislodged, turning the printer into a paperweight. My other one keeps saying bad toner when the toner is new.
customer_reviews.author: M Cash

customer_reviews.title: Tricky wireless set up, but Gutenberg would still be proud!
customer_reviews.text: This little buddy got me (AND my girlfriend) through the bar exam this summer (at least 3000 total pages printed this summer! Eeek, sorry trees!) and should last me far beyond, as long as I'm not an idiot and drop it somewhere. Once you got past the tricky wireless set up (I went to an online mac forum here:  this thing was a dream. It printed crisply, quickly and the duplexing worked pretty well too. Also FYI, you will probably need a replacement toner cartridge printer pretty quickly (I think mine lasted 400ish pages doing almost exclusively duplexing, so 800 pages single sided).
customer_reviews.author: kaywgee

customer_reviews.title: The HL-2270DW be TRIPPIN!!!  my circuit breaker that is...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome awesome laser jet printer but, it to often trips my breakers. I believe I have the AFCI version. I have experienced this in a home build in 2005 and the one I'm in now built in 2007. That is why I knocked it a STAR otherwise awesome workhorse. Have seen other mention variuos surge protectors that might help which I'll have to try such as Trip-lite. My current surge protecteraint cuttin it so far although I must admit, I also have theinstalled on the same surge protector. I'll have to test it out withou the MFC-J4510DW plugged in for a while. Don't hesitate to purchase this bad boy. Extremely worth it...
customer_reviews.author: P@BL()

customer_reviews.title: Fine for everyday printing, but...
customer_reviews.text: This printer Brother HL-2270DW works fine for everyday printing, but when I printed on heavy weight paper(70lb or 65lb) the toner would brush off. I was printing postcard to mail out and the print would wipe off as I was addressing them. I know what you’re thinking, " you didn't use original toner from Brother". Ah, but I did and I also tried some of the cheap refills. So I ended up giving the 2270 away and buying a Brother HL-5450DN and it is working great. I’m guessing the fusing drum didn’t get hot enough to keep the toner on, but this 5450 works great.
customer_reviews.author: KINGOK

customer_reviews.title: 7 years and counting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer on 11/2013 and it's now 5/2020. The toner cartridges lasted 2 years and 5 years, respectively. Super reliable, easy to use. I can't recommend it enough!!
customer_reviews.author: Eunice Ko

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Had to call Brother to get it set up, but they provided excellent service. I had to go through more complex steps than I thought I would, but the customer service person stuck with me through it all, and stayed on the line to wait until I tested it. So, I am well satisfied. Excellent service from Amazon, as always...delivered on time, or earlier... easy to exchange or return...which I have done maybe twice in ten years! You just do things right all the time, so I have no real "need" for customer service. But, I know can it's there if I need it! Craig
customer_reviews.author: Craig S. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Good printer for the price, but could be better
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it does the job well. Especially, when you consider the price of the unit. Pros: Warms up quickly (about 10-15 seconds) when first powered up. The print quality is consistent, on both single and double-sided print jobs. Easy to change the toner cartridge and paper. Network setup is fairly straightforward. Cons: Expect the toner cartridges to wear out much faster than advertised. Double-sided printing with 3-hole paper has been a real challenge (for my printer, anyway). Printing disabled when toner cartridge reads "empty" (firmware setting that can be disabled, but annoying nonetheless). Would I buy it again: Absolutely. Despite the minor annoyances, it's been a great little printer. That's why I have two of them. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Mark K

customer_reviews.title: Best thing is toner if you buy the xl is ...
customer_reviews.text: Previous model has lasted 4 yrs. ( actually still functions) I purchased this as a backup. I have a business and this printer sits out in the warehouse and prints workorders. 90 + summer heat down to 20 - 30 degree winter temps. Humidity and all the rest. Drum takes longer to print in the colder months but that is usually only the first print of the morning. Best thing is toner if you buy the xl is a great value
customer_reviews.author: Gordo Shumway

customer_reviews.title: Laser printers work great
customer_reviews.text: This was our first laser printer and it still works 3+ years later. Highly recommend laser printers and the Brother brand in particular. This printer is wireless so you can put it out of the way and still access it without having to run a long network cable. My favorite feature is duplexing--printing on both sides! You use half the paper and half the space, e.g. a 10 page report is only 5 pages and easy to fit in a folder. There's a web-based interface that you can use to check for error messages, view toner levels, change settings, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Overall good printer for the price, but Mac OS X users face a complicated setup process
customer_reviews.text: Overall good printer for the price, but Mac OS X users face a complicated setup process to get wireless networking configured. Here are the wireless network installations instructions for OS X users from the Brother website. It's not rocket science, but it's a lot more involved than just running a simple setup wizard:  UPDATE: I had to go through this process again for the first time in years and I am blown away by what a hassle it is to get this working on WiFi OS X, so I am dropping this by 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was excellent for four years
customer_reviews.text: I used this printer connected sometimes via ethernet LAN and sometimes USB to Linux (Debian 8, then 9) machines for four years, printing many pages and going through several toners, which were quite economical. (I never tried the WiFi option.) After four years, the automatic paper feeder broke and I can now only print using the manual feeder. Overall: good enough that I now buying a replacement Brother printer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: RIP my HL-2270DW printer Aug 2012- Mar 2015
customer_reviews.text: RIP my HL-2270DW printer (Aug 2012- Mar 2015) I feel like for a $150 printer, I should get more than 2.5 years of printing. Granted, it worked wonderfully for most of that time, with it's fast printing and relatively cheap toner. But for about a year before it's death, there was a period of slow decline in which, occasionally, paper jammed and pages of gibberish printed continuously until I killed the power. I continued to experience these annoyances more often than I think is acceptable even with constant driver updates and re-installings. Still, it gets more than one star for being the best printer I've ever owned, but that's simply because I come from a long history of inkjets.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan B

customer_reviews.title: Nothin' but problems!
customer_reviews.text: Setting it up was overly complicated and time consuming. Once connected, the printing was fast and double-sided. Somewhat loud for a home setting. Errors were frequent and the computer software to control the printer functioned and appeared to be created in North Korea. The ink toner ran out much quicker than expected. Felt like a rip off. I installed a generic toner and it has remained dysfunctional since. Every second page is jammed, Printing ten pages requires paper clearing five pages left to re-print. This malfunction is known. Will invest more in a printer next time I buy. Would not recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Roman

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny and every square inch.
customer_reviews.text: I live in a small New York apartment and my office is literally in the kitchen, so every purchase that takes up valuable space has to be carefully scrutinized. As a small business owner I've found this printer to be indispensable. It's a workhorse and hardy ever jams. It's a life saver for keeping records and at tax time it pays for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Kruetzkamp

customer_reviews.title: 5 years and still running strong!
customer_reviews.text: I have run about 20,000 pages through my Brother printer and it's still running strong. Worth every penny. I will say do not buy the toner cartridges for $50, they are a huge rip off and a lot of waste. You can buy toner refills for $10 and I have been using that for 5 years and never had a problem. There are tons of videos online how to do it, and its really easy.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT D.

customer_reviews.title: Good Value, and That Is What I Look For
customer_reviews.text: This printer is fast enough and reliable enough for me. I only need and want black and white and I do enough printing that I want the speed this printer gives me so it definitely meets my needs. It also is not an expensive printer and I DEFINITELY like the price. I had one which lasted almost 2 years during which I printed out thousands and thousands of pages. The pages were all clear and legible and any paper jams were easily cleared. When it did die I went out and bought the same unit again so that alone should speak for itself. I consider this an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: Henry B. Tripp

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Great printer, wireless capability, Not the easiest to set up WiFi but works good when it’s connected
customer_reviews.author: Chemical Mike

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommeded
customer_reviews.text: I bought this here 4 years ago. I still use this often and it has never given me an issue. I highly recommend this product. If you are on a tight budget and don't need features of a 100 page per minute printer, then this is the best personal printer for occasional printing to have. Software is not needed to use this on Windows 10 or Mac OSX. Both operating systems now recognize this printer. Getting it onto the network using it's wireless capabilities are another story. You will need to use the drivers for windows 10 but not for MacOSX.
customer_reviews.author: MikeMike

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great
customer_reviews.text: Good printer. The wireless setup was a bit of a hassle -- but Brother tech support was patient and helpful. CONS: Expensive Brother brand toner The drum unit requires replacing every 12000 pages, and it costs almost as much as the printer itself. (note: for both the drum and the toner, I have preferred to purchase Brother products as the Brother compatible products that I have tried have been sub-standard) If you every change your wireless password, you need to go through the whole convoluted set-up process over again. PROS: Print quality is excellent Once you do have it set up, it is easy to use and works very well for home-office
customer_reviews.author: ND

customer_reviews.title: Very nice little laser printer for very cheap
customer_reviews.text: Very nice little laser printer for very cheap. Set up was a little complicated but went flawlessly, I recommend reading the instructions thoroughly before starting. I had to insert a CD into my laptop, install software, push a button on the printer, hurry up and push a button on my router, and then finish the software install. But like I said, it worked perfectly after that, and when I fired up my Surface Pro 2, it installed the printer with no further effort. Print quality is good and the paper tray holds half a ream - 250 sheets! Machine is totally quiet when it's not printing. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: J. Peshek

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY FOR A MAC
customer_reviews.text: Had a brother laser in the past and it was great, so I expected this to be a good printer too. Not the case! DO NOT BUY IT FOR A MAC. The Brother HL-2270DW does NOT work with the latest version of Mac OSX, even though it says that it should. Our IT man wasted an hour downloading drivers and farting around before we finally re-boxed the printer. Perhaps it works well with Windows, however this printer does NOT play well with OSX 10.9 (even with the latest driver form Brother's website).
customer_reviews.author: Rick G

customer_reviews.title: A Functional Printer
customer_reviews.text: This Brother EH-L2270DW Wireless Laser Printer is very functional. As expected, it is fast and gives high-quality output. It's adjustable feature makes it easier to place paper on the printer and start printing perfectly. As a guy who are not really into techie stuff, I was having a hard time installing it at first but the manual was very friendly and understandable so I set it up in no time. Thanks to my fiance who helped me with the manual and the installation. I just loved this printer because it delivers the kind of result I expected.
customer_reviews.author: ABQ Express

customer_reviews.title: No AirPrint :( Come on Brother, don't make me upgrade to the higher machines for this. :(
customer_reviews.text: So very frustrated. With all the positive reviews of this printer I was super excited to get a reliable, economic alternative to the junk ink jets out there. Very disappointed after 45 min of setting up wireless (WiFi protected set up failed 4x) that they don't support Apple AirPrint. Going to have to find an alternative as that was a necessity (not being able to from my iPhone or iPad is a non-starter). They offer an app, but it requires that you browse everything with that app and pull all your documents into it. Just not a customer friendly option. Super disappointed as it seems like a very nice machine but will be exchanging tonight.
customer_reviews.author: MS.UT

customer_reviews.title: Amazing printer, wireless setup difficult
customer_reviews.text: Great little printer that can even do double-sided printing. Fantastic for the price. Way better than replacing ink jet cartridges annually. It's reputation for wireless setup is well earned though. Even as techy, it was a huge pain to setup. The instructions are extremely convoluted, so set aside an hour or two of trial and error to get it going. Occasionally it can lose settings so don't throw away those instructions or the software! I've had to reconfigure it twice in the time I've had it.
customer_reviews.author: geekyrunner

customer_reviews.title: Purchased three and a year later only one is working.
customer_reviews.text: Title pretty much says it all. We picked up two for the office and one for the house. None of them were high volume. The one at the house started having problems first, and then one at the office started acting up. It appears to be a problem with the security chip in the 'authentic' brother cartridges. Nice to know they are more interested in stopping people from using non brother cartridges then giving people a printer that works. And no, we never used non brother cartridges. One of the new HPs arrived today, and I anticipate ordering more shortly. Our flirtation with cheap, and I do mean that in the worse way, laser printers is over.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic wireless printer, so far!
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the Amazon box, I was disappointed that the printer box wasn't sealed; it had been opened. But as I removed it and set it up, I found no problems, and it looked as if the printer had not been set up before. This is a fabulous printer that so far STAYS connected with my new WiFi network -- hurrah! I do wish it included the AirPrint feature, but I didn't even realize I needed this until after purchasing this printer. The slightly newer model may include AirPrint, but the reviews for that model are much more mixed, so I'm happy that I chose this slightly older model.
customer_reviews.author: Boston-shoe-lover

customer_reviews.title: Never turning back.
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off by saying something that is pretty well-known: Inkjet printers are a waste of money. Ink is expensive, and as a student, I need to print quite often. That's where this Brother Laserjet printer came in. I wanted to make the switch from Inkjet to Laserjet because it's just more economical. I didn't think of the quality of the print or the speed at all. Boy, was I suprised. This is the #1 rated laserjet printer on Amazon, and there is a good reason for that. The printer is incredibly easy to set up, fast, energy and ink efficient, and all around a very welcome product to have as a student.
customer_reviews.author: Frugal Human

customer_reviews.title: so good. Was no problem connecting this to WiFi
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Was no problem connecting this to WiFi. I have printed 1 couple hundred sheets. So far, so good. I am pleased with the speed and quality. Instead of letting all of the software install onto computer, I download the driver only to my computer from the Brother website, then used the Windows 7 printer detection feature to find the printer. (instructions on how to put the printer into searchable mode are in the manual). Once Windows found the printer, I directed the install process to the drivers folder downloaded from the web, and everything installed fine, printer works great. I just don't like bloatware that gets installed from those 'installation disks'.
customer_reviews.author: Andy in Utah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Home Laser Printer
customer_reviews.text: I needed a laser printer to print occasional documents. This fits that bill, and uses wireless so I don't have to clutter my desk with another cable. Setup was easy, and I have not encountered a single issue with it. It is fast, text is sharp, and it feeds thicker laser stocks with no jamming. I have printed a fair amount so far, and haven't encountered a single issue. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this printer to anyone looking for an affordable home laser printer.
customer_reviews.author: MrFotografer

customer_reviews.title: A printer that works when I need it
customer_reviews.text: I used to have an all-in-one printer that would scan, print photos and copy. It was an inkjet, used a lot of ink when printing and had a gravity type paper feeder that would never align correctly and usually cause a jam. I then decided to get a B&W Laser as all I usually printed was pages that didn't require color and with online photo printing being relatively inexpensive I didn't see a reason to have a printer that could print a photo a requirement. I specifically looked for a laser printer with a bottompage feeder system and this one fits perfectly. Easy to setup, easy to print and it works when I click the print button.
customer_reviews.author: samiam

customer_reviews.title: When it works, it's great, but that only happens 80% of the time.
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it's great, but be prepared to lose the duplex functioning every very often for no apparent reason and lose total functioning every so often (whether through wifi or USB port, the printer just doesn't connect). This printer has stranded me on too many occasions, so I've started to print important documents days before I need them in case the printer decides it doesn't want to print that day. Sometimes turning it off for 1-5 minutes helps, other times, it doesn't. Very frustrating printer, definitely a love-hate relationship.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for about 4 years now, and it has held up incredibly well. Very reliable, and conservative with the toner. And getting it to work with various oddly-shaped pages is surprisingly easy. The only downside I've found is that getting it properly networked via a wireless router is a little tedious (it's often necessary to go through the steps again every time one changes the wireless password). But for me at least, that's hardly something to be bothered over. It's been a great value for home use.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Best printer purchase ever after tens of thousands of pages!
customer_reviews.text: Best printer purchase I ever made. Love the clear crisp characters and the fact I can make thousands of copies before changing the Cartridge. The cost is couple of cents per copy as opposed to ink jet costs. ALMOST 2 years have passed since review and the printer is still going strong. It remains the best printer purchase ever. I have printed reams & reams of bond with little or no problems. UPDATE: It has been more than 7 years since purchase and it still serves me well with only replacement (several times ) of toner cartridge. It has now printed thousands of pages with no problems. It remains the best printer purchase I have ever made.
customer_reviews.author: j l osborne

customer_reviews.title: Works fine over a few years
customer_reviews.text: It does what it is designed to do. It's a B&W toner printer requiring a USB wire connected to transfer the data for printing. Never had a malfunction. I keep it as a bulk printer instead of using my Brother B&W wireless 3 in 1.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: It actually prints when I click print.  How great is that?
customer_reviews.text: I click on the "print" button and get this. The Printer actually prints stuff. Unlike our old HP printer that would take an act of congress anytime you wanted to print something. It's pure heaven having a printer that just prints. It also works in Linux. Super low stand-by power. With super fast wake up and print. 880 Watts printing 3.4 watts fan-on 2.0 watts standby 0.0 watts off I love that it has a hard power switch. When it's off, it's off. No phantom power. Cons: The fan is kind of loud. Also it has a strong "laser printer/ ozone smell" when printing.
customer_reviews.author: John Loveless

customer_reviews.title: Not bad printer, especially for the price, but with some problems
customer_reviews.text: The printer arrived yesterday. It prints well, but there are several things people who are going to buy it should be aware of. 1. It's very loud. 2. It takes much more room than you expect. The footprint of the printer is slightly above 14" x 14" with height of 7", but manual requires to leave about 4" (10 cm) clearance on each side of the printer. 3. I tried to connect it to my home WiFi, but it refused when I attempted to connect is using WPS. So, I used just local USB connection, with which it works fine. 4. Important options (such as setting to use the toner save mode) are hidden deeply in the setup.
customer_reviews.author: Yuriy

customer_reviews.title: Just Buy It!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute beautiful printer the print quality is excellent!!!! and I don't understand the complaints about noise this thing is whisper quite. Of course it makes a little noise while printing and then afterwards the db's immediately drop and it's barely audible while it waits incase you want additions printing done now you can of course have it shut off immediately after printing but then it would have to go through that entire warm up process. The wifi is great had no trouble hooking it up within minutes after receiving it just READ the instructions and you should be good. Only negative as others have stated is that you might need a cheat sheet for some of the functions.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: so far so great
customer_reviews.text: Had this about 3 months..........impressed with the work horse idea. Cost efficient. Just prints. Just black & white. Which means the cartridge doesn't have to be replaced in 3 months for s $30 cartridge because your "magenta" level is low! I have not had to go through replacing toner yet (which is good!).......so I can't address how easy that is or how long it will be before it requires replacement. Set up was incredibly simple.......love that it is wireless & the MY ONLY concern is whether your computer will be compatible with wireless feature.......my son got a new Mac last year which isn't compatible, my Mac is older & no issues.......just double check whether your computer is compatible........
customer_reviews.author: sunflower

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, Simple, just works
customer_reviews.text: I have serviced copiers for 16 years and mostly work on the brand that starts with the letter C. Customers of mine who own filthy, old, nasty looking brother devices swear by them and won't let them go. I have even taken a few of them apart. The design is so ridiculously simple it is genius. I hate how complex paper feed systems are on machines that jam all the time, while the simple ones just work. That is why I bought this. With every manufacturer making cheap throwaways, I decided on one with less complexity that is super easy to refill cartridges with toner myself. The drum life is crazy compared to how cheap it is to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey

customer_reviews.title: BEST PRINTER I HAVE EVER HAD
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this printer. This bad boy has never let me down! PROS: •Quiet (a little humming noise when printing which doesn't bother me at all and is honestly the most quiet printer I've ever dealt with) •Small size so it fits perfectly under my desk •WiFi enabled so you're able to print from anywhere in the house •Prints front and back with ease •Functions great (haven't had a paper jam yet; fingers crossed!) •Holds almost a whole ream of paper •Big toner cartridge (so you don't have to replace them as often) •Easy setup CONS: •None yet but will update if I come across anything
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to give this little printer 4.5 stars. It does its job well, and wireless networking was easy to set up. No cable other than the power cord clutters the floor. The printer looses a star because it is more noisy than I think it should be. When printing, it clunks a lot. Higher-cost printers mute those mechanical sounds. But most annoying is a buzzy fan that runs for a full ten minutes after the printer goes to sleep. So, with a one minute sleep time, you get eleven minutes of fan noise. The fan noise might not be noticed in a busy office. If you're looking for functionality at low cost, the HL-2270DW should meet your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Dogcatcher

customer_reviews.title: Good printer for the office.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as an exact model replacement for one that crapped out after 3 years. Old one just would not reset. Kept going into an error mode when attempting to print. And the drum was fine. Like the speed of the printer, and it is easy to clear jams and load toner. So giving a second one a chance. Brother printers are finicky and like genuine Brother parts and toner. So you do not get the luxury of using refurbished off-brand toner. Be ready for slightly higher maintenance costs. But Brother printers do work well. At least until they crap out.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Wagonis

customer_reviews.title: Super Satisfied with this Workhorse Laser Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer has been a real workhorse for me, as was the previous model. Super satisfied. I doubt I'll ever go back to inkjet printing. It's slightly quirky about providing information to the Mac about the toner supply level, but I can always go to the web interface and get that info.
customer_reviews.author: John Weise

customer_reviews.title: For the price, you can't beat it! Got ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you can't beat it! Got this because our older laser printer wasn't compatible with the new Apple laptop. So simple to do 2-sided copies. Just tell it to and the printer does the rest. It will also automatically print the correct order of pages for small booklets. Got tired of paying a small fortune for ink jet refills! What a ripoff! With a $40 high yield toner cartridge, it prints and prints and prints. We've been using it since 2011 and we are still on the original toner cartridge!!! You want color, go print at Walmart or Target.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Not cool.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great printer until it experienced "Main motor failure" after about 180 pages. Unfortunately it's out of warranty. The printer was never moved, and not used very often. It's predecessor (an HL-2070N) lasted for almost 8 years and I was expecting the same quality. I understand that imperfections can exist, but I was really surprised by the response from support. I guess I'm just spoiled by more modern companies' customer service experience (Amazon, for example). I'm hoping this won't cost more than $40 to fix, but I'm probably never buying Brother again.
customer_reviews.author: The DeLisles

customer_reviews.title: good output, still working after few months of use ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a deal. Seventy bucks for a laser with wired LAN, woohoo! (It has wireless too, but I don't use it) Working in home with kids printing regularly for school. Quick printing, good output, still working after few months of use and still no problems. It has a nice web interface too for tweaking configuration of ink usage, ink level left in cartridge and so forth. I only install minimum drivers on win 7 machines, and don't use all the monitoring software that is optional (bloatware). Works from linux mint 16 too. Wakes up quickly and silently when a print job is sent to it while it is in sleep mode (using less power).
customer_reviews.author: scorlock

customer_reviews.title: Double Feeds
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer 4 years ago and have had an issue of double feeding paper for the last 2 years. No matter what I do to try and solve the issue it continues to double feed. I only paid $79.99 4 years ago. I can't believe this printer is now over $200.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Toner Issue
customer_reviews.text: It prints a little lighter than I'd like, and I am really bothered by the fact that my sample toner cartridge lasted less than 100 printed pages. I do know that the cartridges that come with printers are always low yield ... but really? Anyway, I did order a full / high yield cartridge when I bought the printer. When I replaced the sample cartridge with the high yield cartridge, I hadn't even printed 100 pages before ... again ... the toner button lit up on the printer, indicating that I was low on toner. Really??!! I do like the small footprint.
customer_reviews.author: D. Riddle

customer_reviews.title: Good little printer.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I ordered this because; a) I do occasional printing, b) I don't require color and c) my desk was getting crowded. Since I finally got the wireless hooked up it has worked extremely well. If you follow the steps in the manual, wireless should be painless to hook up, the problem was in my provider. Brother was helpful in tracking down that the issue actually was my provider, then they helped fix it..... shouldn't be a problem for most. Anyway, prints well, should do fine in the future.....but has printed about 20 items in the past week with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Ray T

customer_reviews.title: Great workhorse printer that is super reliable and cheap to operate.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second printer of this model purchased. The first I have had for several years now and so when my father in law relocated to the area and needed a new printer I knew right what to get him. This printer has been without incident, I mean not a hiccup through 50+ reams of paper. I have not had any compatibility issues with windows 7 or 8. The wireless networking is cake to hookup and the driver is not bloated. Another reason to purchase this printer is that the cartridges can be found either on sale, or inexpensive generics are made. These cartridges go on sale almost monthly if you watch deal sites.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: If you use OS X Yosemite, setup will take longer.
customer_reviews.text: So far, great print quality and speed. My only complaint? Pretty much impossible to set up if you have OS X Yosemite. Luckily, my teenage son has a Windows 7 gaming rig, and he was able to set this up on our wireless network in very little time. Once on the network, OS X printer drivers installed fine, and the printer works great from both Mac and Windows computers. With any luck, Brother will release an update to their installation software to address this problem. Otherwise, the whole family has been very happy with this printer, and because it is wireless, we have a lot of options for placement; very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: montana_nick

customer_reviews.title: Very nice printer for its price
customer_reviews.text: This B&W laser printer fits my budget and get my works done nicely. It looks and feels like a cheap product because everything is practically made of plastic...BUT, it works beautifully. Operation is easy, printing speed is decent, and the printing quality is pretty good. It can print both side. This is not a machine to print your Ph D dissertation or your multi-million dollar proposal. This is a wonderful machine for your everyday printing needs. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Chin

customer_reviews.title: This was probably one of the best gifts I've given my father who frequently talked about ...
customer_reviews.text: This was probably one of the best gifts I've given my father who frequently talked about the waste of paper printing only on one side. Setup on the home network I setup for him and he loves being able to sit in front of the TV with his laptop and being able to send things to the printer wirelessly. He said he hasn't once had a problem with a document printing and being ready when he goes to pick it up. Does seem to go through toner more quickly than other Brother printers I've used though.
customer_reviews.author: CountryGent

customer_reviews.title: Best Printer I Ever Had !
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer! I have had the other brands that do everything but cook your dinner for you...the ones that suck up ink just sitting there, so every time you want to use them you have to add new ink:- ( not a happy situation). This one just does what it is supposed to do and does it quickly and precisely. Every time I use it I am glad that I bought it! Good job Brother! Have to sing the praises of Brother, again. Three years later I love it even more! I have never had a single problem with it---NOTHING HAS EVER GONE WRONG! Yes, I was shouting. Some things are worth shouting about.:-)
customer_reviews.author: EQUUS

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, fast, reliable printer with phenomenal cost-per-page.
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal printer. I've had mine for about a year and, in that time, printed thousands of pages. The printer is quiet, fast, and reliable; it never jams, and the print quality is terrific. Plus, the toner cartridges last for absolute ages. I'm never going back to an inkjet. UPDATE: After four and a half years, this baby is STILL going strong. I’ve printed several thousands of pages on it, and it even connects to my WiFi so I can print from my phone. This printer will outlive us all. When the robot revolution comes, I will be happy to serve this printer and revere it as my master.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Lewin

customer_reviews.title: Brother customer service waste of time
customer_reviews.text: Product stopped working before the toner ran out. Brother customer service waste of time. I probably printed less than 100 pages, very light user. Now I just go to the library, till I go to Wally World for a disposable hp printer. This was not a cheap printer either!
customer_reviews.author: Waterford

customer_reviews.title: WOW!  Super happy!
customer_reviews.text: Letting everyone know upfront, this printer is already at least 4 years old or more when I downloaded the software but for the price for the printer and the toner I cannot complain. Wow. I went from an inkjet printer that just eats up money in ink cartridges alone. It prints fast and has a convenient tray for envelopes right in the front of it. (where it shows the brother logo). I purchased this printer strictly for printing out coupons so I am happy with the extra features other than it not being a color printer will now use as my main printer! Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: binkisoto799

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: We are very satisfied with this printer. My wife uses the printer primarily for printing her sheet music arrangements for her flute ensemble, so she doesn't need a color printer and the cost of printing is far less than with an inkjet. We previously had a couple wireless inkjet printers that had unreliable wireless operation, usually requiring frequent rebooting to re-establish the connection. This printer has been working for several months without having to restart even once. The double-sided printing is a great feature, and has worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Punim

customer_reviews.title: Believe The Hype
customer_reviews.text: Got tired of relying on CNET's printer reviews after my last printer gave me fits for a few years. One person really can't effectively review something like a printer in a day or so. After multiple parts replacements by the manufacturer I decided to chuck it and simplify things with a straight black and white laser. Noticed that this one was Amazon's #1 best selling laser printer with close to 3,000 reviews averaging more than four stars. I thought that this seemed a lot more reliable than one "expert" opinion. I have been thrilled after two months of use. Very nice, simple unit. Easy install. Prints very fast. quick cartridge in/out.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Trahan

customer_reviews.title: This printer rocks - don't let the 1-3 star reviews influence you
customer_reviews.text: There are a ton of great 5-star reviews which I mostly echo; I would like to debunk a majority of the 1-3 star reviews which indicate this printer is (1) noisy and (2) hard to set up on your wifi network. (1) When the printer is printing, yes it makes noise, but for a brief moment. It's not the leaf blower that the Debbie Downers say it is. (2) I was able to connect three computers on my network to this printer within 5 minutes. Mac, Win7 & Win8 machines. Don't be intimidated by the poor reviews, this printer works great. It's also FAST - once you hit the print button the page comes out within seconds. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and works very well
customer_reviews.text: Our ancient Brother laser printer finally died, and I went straight to Amazon and found this printer. It had excellent reviews, and the one feature that we really wanted: duplex printing. I ordered late one night, it arrived two days later, and I had it completely set up and running in about 20 minutes, hooked up by USB to an iMac and shared among all the laptops and wireless devices in the house on the Wi-Fi/Mac network. The print quality is excellent even in Draft Toner Saver mode, duplex works well and saves us a lot of paper, and it's only noisy when it's awake, which is only when it's printing. Otherwise it's completely silent. Great printer.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Better than an inkjet
customer_reviews.text: Stop buying inkjets. They're a scam to get you to waste money on ink. These Brother toner cartridges last forever. Even after the toner warning lights up, it keeps printing. As long as you don't need color, this is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kenja Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Best little printer ever!
customer_reviews.text: This little printer is the BEST. It just WORKS. I've changed the toner once, and added lots of paper. It connected up with my router wirelessly with zero drama. Best of all, laser toner is immune to the printer industry's annoying planned obsolescence of dried out inkjet cartridges. I leave this little guy turned on 24/7/365, and it sleeps quietly in its corner of my home office. It warms up for a print job in seconds and it works EVERY TIME. Finally, a no-hassle printer that I can simply ignore and count on to do its job!
customer_reviews.author: David Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Quality home printer
customer_reviews.text: Quality build and easy to use and setup. It was practically plug and play. I have been using this printer for approximately 5 years and it's still running strong. Especially with the cheap laser cartridge options on Amazon, I doubt I'll be needing another printer anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: GadgetsnMore

customer_reviews.title: Great Bang-for-the-Buck
customer_reviews.text: Considering it's less than $100 - this printer comes with a fantastic set of features; wireless and duplex printing. The print quality isn't perfect; tends to be dark with grey tones, but if you're just needing to print documents - look no further. Pros: - Wireless / Networked Printing - Duplex Printing - Reliable / Consistent Results Cons: - Provided Toner is very low yield (a few hundred pages at best) - Initial setup is somewhat difficult (have an ethernet cable handy) - Needs to be on a surge protector as it has a considerable draw when spooling a print; can trip breakers and cause light-flickering if not on an independent circuit
customer_reviews.author: Isaac S.

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my HL-2040 with the HL-2270DW and prints envelopes easily without removing trays.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a printer that was easy to use for everyday printing of letters and envelopes with a special feed for envelopes. Although I needed Brother Tech Support to help me set it up wirelessly, they helped me immediately and the process was simple to walk through. I now have a wireless printer for printing letters and envelopes easily and simply. It is a gem of a printer and the price was right too. I have four printers. My other printers were impossible to use for envelopes this one does it perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: The Gabster

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: This review is for Brother HL-2270DW Compact Laser Printer. If you buy this printer to use on a wireless network go to the Brother support site and download the Nettool. It is a quick repair tool if you lose connectivity. Other than having to run the aforementioned tool once or twice a month no problems at all. Only used a quality paper and only printed letter sized paper so cannot state how it fairs with other sizes. There are lots tweeks that you can find through searches explaining how to get more life out of your toner cartridge etc. Not disappointed with this purchase at all.
customer_reviews.author: Roosterman

customer_reviews.title: printing quality is good, but comparing with that another brand printer i ...
customer_reviews.text: After 1 year of using it and comparing to another printer of that class: 1. When it turns on or starts printing, light blinks in the room. Tested at two different apartments. 2. From time to time printing queue is getting stuck, and you have to turn it off-on, reinstall drivers, and dance around with shaman's tambourine. Tested on 5 different devices. 3. Really noisy and go-to-sleep time is too long, initially i thought it will never go sleep. I mean - it works, of course, printing quality is good, but comparing with that another brand printer i can safely tell i would never buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Joss13

customer_reviews.title: Older model...but the most economical way to print.
customer_reviews.text: Inkjet printers will bleed your wallet to death, yes color is nice but unnecessary for 99% of your printing. This prints incredibly fast, will print both sides without interference from you, works great. Included driver does not work for modern Apple OS's, i'm running 10.8 and had to download a generic driver that works only while plugged into a USB port...i know it will connect to my network, i just havent't figured it out yet and i'm fine with the USB cable so far. The price i paid was 89 dollars....fantastic for the cheapskate in me, but had i to do it over again i would buy a more current model in hopes the driver issue would be solved.
customer_reviews.author: J. Parkes

customer_reviews.title: So far I like this printer
customer_reviews.text: So far I like this printer. Two things which could make it much better. 1. It sometimes makes a noise; maybe it is trying to cool off? I don't know but having it on my desk when it does this is a little distracting. 2. The need toner light and notification on my computer has happened......I am still printing pages about 200 pages later, without any fading. I think this warning appears to signal a little too soon. For now though, I have printed 1,000 pages and I am still on the cartridge that came with the printer. So for that I am thrilled!
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer with duplex. Works fine with linux, network and usb.
customer_reviews.text: If you are connecting this to Linux wifi I suggest that you have a router with push button auto device connect. I started with a non secure connection which was easy. I put MAC addressing enabled on the router. A single fast click on the network button on the back of the printer will set it up. Be sure to download and install the linux drivers from Brothers site first. Plenty of good instructions on the web. Use Google. Regarding the printer. It is hard to imagine a printer printing faster. I also bought a refill kit with the printer that I will tryout on the OEM cartridge. I will review that when I use it. So far great experience.
customer_reviews.author: tlcstat

customer_reviews.title: Really good printer for the money.
customer_reviews.text: 1) Fast and easy wireless network setup. 2) Warms up fast and print speed and quality are very good. 3) In addition to paper tray you can feed individual sheets through separate slot, perfect for shipping labels so you don't need to open the tray to add single sheet. 4) I've printed about 20 pages per day for the last 3 months without a single problem, so far so good. 5) Used it for 2 sided pages and booklet printing and worked great for these applications. 6) I highly recommend this printer. UPDATE: 5-20-15 Been using daily for almost 2 years and still prints as good as the day I installed. I love this printer.

customer_reviews.title: Laser over ink any day
customer_reviews.text: I really like this printer. Once you go to laser you will never go back to ink. The pages prints in about one second. You also save a lot of money on ink cartridges becauae laser toner lasts much longer. Be aware that the toner cartridge that comes with the printer will not last as long as when you buy a replacement. This is the way pretty much all laser printers are. The manufactor gives you a smaller one to get started. Once you replace it though, a toner cartridge should last you over a year, depending on use. Try getting that from an ink printer!
customer_reviews.author: Mark M

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Solid
customer_reviews.text: I'm not very knowledgeable when it comes to printers. I also don't really care for anything too complicated. This printer is simple and does the job (not to mention relatively well priced compared to other laser printers). The only issue I had, was connecting it to my home wireless connection. Just do a Google search for how to set it up and you'll be set. It's not complicated if you can read and follow step by step directions. Also, if you're ordering a printer for the first time (like me), get a printer cable as well. You'll need it for the installation. All in all, good buy so far.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: easy, professional, and efficient.
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough to set up. I connected with a USB cord and I found the wireless setup wizard and printer driver downloads on the brother website. The printer is efficient and exactly what I wanted to replace my slow inkjet. Upon the printer's arrival, I eagerly tried a number of different maneuvers suggested in internet forums to get the printer linked and running without a USB cord. I wound up deciding that purchasing the USB cord was worth saving me from the headache.
customer_reviews.author: JustaGirl

customer_reviews.title: Print quality is very good. Once it's set up
customer_reviews.text: Print quality is very good. Once it's set up, it's very easy to use. Initial set up may be a bit confusing (for wireless printing). Be sure to go step by step with the instruction. I am printing from downstairs couch to the printer in the home office upstairs. Saved the cable issue and the hassle of having to connect my laptop to the printer every time I have to print. Toner price is fairly good compare to those for HP printers ($48 on Amazon last time I saw it)
customer_reviews.author: Eric C

customer_reviews.title: As a basic printer, this is great!!p
customer_reviews.text: I already had the same model printer at another residence so I ordered a second one for my use at home. It only prints--doesn't copy etc--but then for the price, what does? I wanted a laser printer to avoid problems with long intervals of non-use that is deadly to ink-jet printers. I never have such problems with my Brother 2270 printers and I am getting lots of copies from aftermarket cartridges which cost far less than OEM Brother cartridges. This is a very basic printer and a very good one. Given its singularity of function, buyers should be as pleased as I have been.
customer_reviews.author: ralph glorioso

customer_reviews.title: Great little wireless laser printer B/W
customer_reviews.text: Love my Brother wireless laser printer. I have had this for many years and it is still going strong. I don't typically need to print out much at home, but having this laser printer has been great. English papers and coupons are just some of the uses for this printer and I especially like that it is wireless. Will need to look into a Google Cloud Print version next to support Chromebooks, but otherwise, this is a champ!
customer_reviews.author: Oni

customer_reviews.title: Great printer worth the price
customer_reviews.text: These are great printers. I have several setup up at work and they just keep going. We've printed thousands of pages and the printers just keep on printing. I was amazed to find that these could print on 80# bond (card stock), but not in duplex. The duplex option is a real paper saver. BUT becareful, Amazon show "THE NEWER MODEL" as the Brother HL-L2340DW which does not support Wired Ethernet. oh, and the HL-L2340DW has an ATTACHED POWER CORD. Stick with the HL-2270DW it's worth the extra it gives you more options.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Able to be setup wirelessly on OSX 10.8.X with a Time Capsule, but not easily.
customer_reviews.text: Yesterday I received my new HL-2270DW and was immediately pleased with the small size and simple design. The main reason I bought this printer was for it's WIFI capability so I started the process of getting it on my wireless network. I put the included CD into my iMac running 10.8.4 and found out quickly that the setup is not compatible with OSX 10.8.X. So much for the easy way. I did some trial and error and ended up adding the 2270DW to my Time Capsule network by using these particular instructions from Brothers website:  So far I'd give 5 stars to the printer itself and 3 stars to Brothers Mac software support.
customer_reviews.author: Adam C.

customer_reviews.title: Fast Printing, But Some Flaws
customer_reviews.text: I really like the printer since it prints documents quickly. However, I have been a bit annoyed by the standby feature after a document has been printed. The fan still seems to be running, and it takes a while for it to turn off. Since I use this product in a relatively quiet environment, this bothers me a bit. Pages might come out a bit curled, but this printer delivers fast printing speed and affordable ink costs, which makes it perfect for printing map directions and personal documents. The curled pages is a minor "annoyance", but it's still hardly noticeable. Otherwise, this printer delivers quick printouts. I'm satisfied with this product except for the minor flaws listed above.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Nearly impossible wifi setup
customer_reviews.text: The printer works so well that I hate to leave a three-star rating. The sad truth, however, is that the wireless setup was nearly impossible. I found my solution on an unaffiliated corporate internet technology site that most users simply would not think to consult, as the manufacturer's site proved useless in this regard. Note that (i) my router and PCs are either new or have been purchased within the last 12 months, (ii) are and have been fully functional throughout, and (iii) have worked flawlessly with this product since the cumbersome process of setting it up was completed. Caveat emptor: buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: notknwn_

customer_reviews.title: Great for home computer, not so great for tablet
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this for its wireless printing capability. I had often needed to print something from my tablet and thought this would be a good printer to accomplish that. However, that is not the case. For some reason Brother only puts the "Apple Airprint" capabilities on their larger office size printers. I can't understand this. I would think that most people wanting to print from their tablet, would be doing so at home. Therefore not needing a large office printer. I gave it 3 stars due to the fact that it works well with my laptop computer.
customer_reviews.author: B. Judd

customer_reviews.title: No Problems Here!!
customer_reviews.text: Tried it using: USB Ethernet cable Wireless (via web interface) USB configuration is pretty standard. Ethernet is pretty standard, too. (You'll have to know the IP, of course) Wireless setup will require you to connect via Ethernet first, then adjust the wireless settings, save, and lastly it will prompt you to disconnect the cable. Once done it automatically prints a page showing either success or failure with causes. The web interface software is truly outstanding, as is this printer's performance. (It DOES help to know a little about networking of course.) I'm using a static IP wirelessly now.
customer_reviews.author: An old soldier

customer_reviews.title: If you want a paperweight, it's great!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely frustrating printer. The wireless functionality is always going in and out. I stupidly bought the newer version of this printer, and it is exactly the same. You have to turn it on/off every time you want it to work. And half the time that doesn't even work. Just a really expensive paperweight at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Finally bought myself a laser printer after an endless stream of ink jets that all eventually failed for one reason or another. This is fast, small, and about the same price as an ink jet. So, I gave up the ability to print in color--big deal. I don't print much anyway. This thing was only $80!! Best part: the toner cartridges for it will last 4-6 times as long as ink cartridges did in the past, for a lower cost/ea too. The cost per page for printing is about 1/12 was it was. Hope it keeps working forever. Also, love the extremely small desktop footprint. Takes up less space than my previous Cannon MX-300 MFC did. :)
customer_reviews.author: ♥ Books and gadgets

customer_reviews.title: Superb printer
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for six months and have not experienced any problems. It prints clearly and the paper feeds seamlessly. Duplexing is awesome! Update: This printer is over three and a half years old, and it's still chugging along like the "Little Engine Who Could!" It easily puts out 100+ pages a week, and still runs really well. I can't remember the last time I had it jam; it's only done it a couple times. It's been set up on several wireless networks as I've moved offices; the setup is easy every time. If I find myself in need of another BW laser printer, I expect I'll call upon the Brother HL-2270DW again.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: The best printer
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this printer for about a year or so and recently purchased another one to give to my parents for Christmas. This is seriously the best consumer printer I have ever owned. Setup is a breeze and the cost per page to print is next to nothing. I am still on the toner cartridge that came with the unit and it has been going strong for over 14 months now. I print a decent amount too. I really can't recommend this printer more. I have been frustrated by so many bad consumer printers in the past and this one has zero complaints from me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Review Dude

customer_reviews.title: This printer is hard to beat.
customer_reviews.text: I had an older version of this printer that lasted for years, but then finally quit. I really like this newer version. It starts printing much quicker than the old one and is generally faster kicking out several pages in a short time. I have 3 Brother printers of different models for specific jobs and placed in various areas. I've tried other brands, but have always come back to Brother for the quality, value, features and reliability. This particular printer takes up little space, fast, great print quality and at a good price. If you don't need color, then this is a great choice for everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dell

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse printer gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer four years ago, in August 2011, and since then, despite using it several times a week, I am still only on its second toner cartridge. This printer has proven ridiculously awesome over the years. For a home-use b&w laser printer at this price point, it is very fast and easy to use/set up (even on a Mac). The duplex function works perfectly, and I haven't had any problems using specialty paper, including cardstock and label sheets. In fact, I don't think I've even had a paper jam in the last four years! This thing is a workhorse and I'll keep using it until the proverbial wheels fall off.
customer_reviews.author: scarykarrey

customer_reviews.title: A must buy Laser Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my home office. Here are my thoughts: Pros: 1. Duplex printing 2. Very, very fast printing. 3. Very easy to setup for Windows, OSX, and iOS. 4. Ergonomic. Only a single button that controls the printer. 5. Inexpensive toner. Much cheaper than ink per page. 6. Very clear instructions and comes with an install DVD. 7. Huge paper tray. 8. Wired or Wireless shared printer. Cons: 1. Nothing I can see. Summary: I use this to print my Black and white docs. I use my Kodak 3.1 Inkjet for Color docs. I save money that way.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. WhoTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I've used for for many months without trouble. I`m a home user and got this to help save on the cost of ink. This has printed much more on just the starter ink than I`ve ever done with an inkjet so I`m very happy with it. I'm convinced that in the long run I`ll easily save the cost of this machine in saved ink. It starts up really fast as well, just a couple seconds, which is very impressive to me. I also find it trouble free loading and it holds more paper than I`m used to. Couldn't be happier for those times when color and/or photo quality aren't an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jaynes

customer_reviews.title: Zero problems, dirt cheap, I loves me some Brother printers!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the printer. We loved the first one so much we bought a second one. I think we've had the second one seven months, the first one probably a year. The first one I use at home and keep refilling the toner cartridge myself so it's dirt cheap to run. Wife uses the second at work and we've had zero problems out of both of them. It's so nice to be able to print over the wireless network, how did mankind survive before network printers? And it'll print both sides of the page, what is not to love? It was $116 and refilling toner cartridges costs five or six bucks if you buy in bulk.
customer_reviews.author: contactbarker

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: I've never loved... or even liked... a home printer before. This printer is awesome, end of story. It's easy to get hung up on it being monochrome or not having a scanner, but since I bought it over a year ago I've needed to scan two sheets and the few things I've printed in color I wouldn't want to do on a hundred dollar printer anyway. This printer is perfect, you can get refills very cheap online, the duplex function works perfectly, the wifi takes about 15 minutes to set up. Perfect for home or light office use.
customer_reviews.author: MikeJ

customer_reviews.title: Poor WiFi connectivity
customer_reviews.text: Have been using for over 4 years. The WiFi connectivity is poor at best, working for a while then stop. Hard wired to computer and never a problem. Toner lasts forever and never dries up like the inkjets.
customer_reviews.author: jb

product_meta.title: Brother HL-2270DW Compact Laser Printer with Wireless Networking and Duplex
product_meta.description: Style:Printer (Old Model)The hl-2270dw is a compact, monochrome laser printer with built-in wireless and ethernet network interfaces for small office or home office printer sharing. it features a fast print speed up to 27ppm, automatic duplex printing for two-sided documents, and up to 2400 x 600 dpi resolution for high-quality output. in addition, the printer’s stylish, space-saving design fits virtually anywhere.the hl-2270dw provides flexible paper handling via an adjustable, 250-sheet capacity tray and a manual by-pass slot for printing thicker media. it also offers a high-yield 2,600-page replacement toner cartridge to help lower operating costs and a toner save mode for less critical business documents.What's in the box: Brother HL-2270DW Compact B/W Laser Printer with Wireless Networking & Duplex, Starter Toner Cartridge (700 Pages), DR420 Drum Unit, CD-ROM - User's Manual and Printer Drivers, AC Power Cord, Quick Set-Up Guide and 1-Year Limited Warranty.
feature_bullets: Built-in wireless and Ethernet network interfaces
Automatic duplex printing for two-sided documents
